blog.description:
I am Bleach TRASH. NSFW. INTP/INFJ. BPD. OCD. Old, get off my lawn.  Half-Chuck Bass, Half-Pinkie Pie. Author. Unicorns. Artist. Villians make me moist. Ulquiorra is my DADDY. Jacob Seed is hot. John Seed, may I please confess? AcePolySapioPan. Brat. Libra. Gamer. Tattoos. Pierced. Books. Broken. Anime. Fourth Espada. Sith. Slytherin. Death Eater. Aerith. Zombies. Glitter. The Sims. New Vegas.
Harry Potter. Free!. BNHA. Yuuri On Ice. Trigun. Death Note. Tokyo Ghoul. Star Wars. Final Fantasy VII. Final Fantasy X. Final Fantasy XV. Silent Hill. Labrynith. The Joker. Walking Dead. Romeroverse. iZombie. Far Cry 5/New Dawn.

summary: You've seen Captain Marvel? Do you think Maria Rambeau's daughter Monica is going to be the Superhero Photon?
question: You've seen Captain Marvel? Do you think Maria Rambeau's daughter Monica is going to be the Superhero Photon?
answer:
In the hands of a good writer, yes.

I know that a lot of people were salty that they made Monica a little girl in the Captain Marvel movie, but my immediate thought was the movie took place in the past, so “little” Monica should be a grown woman now.

In the comics, there was a period in time where Carol and Monica both shared the name, Captain Marvel. Monica could be Captain Marvel, or Photon, or Spectrum. In the hands of a capable writer (Ava Duvernay, cough cough) anything is possible. Monica’s character has a lot of Marvel history to draw from.

body:
ENDGAME SPOILERS

.

.

.

.

So after everything was done, Tony was dead and Thanos wiped out, the Avengers still had all 6 infinity stones which Captain America later returns to their respective timelines. So before Captain took the stones away, why didn’t Dr. Strange use the Time Stone to revive Tony? That was obviously possible .

summary: ‪To those who say that they “dishonored” the character of Mar-Vell in captain marvel,‬ Mar-Vell in the movie saved as many...
body:
‪To those who say that they “dishonored” the character of Mar-Vell in captain marvel,‬ Mar-Vell in the movie saved as many innocents as she could, tried to stop wars around the galaxy and went out guns a blazing like a goddamn hero instead of dying slowly of cancer. If them turning Mar-Vell into a woman is seen as the ultimate defiling of the character to you, then I think it says a lot more about you than it does the film.

EDIT: if this came across as me saying that dying of cancer is “dishonorable” I am very sorry and didn’t mean for it to come off that way. Just saying that this version still had a good and respectful death, even without the cancer.

EDIT: if this came across as me saying that dying of cancer is “dishonorable” I am very sorry and didn’t mean for it to come off that way. Just saying that this version still had a good and respectful death, even without the cancer.

summary: Avengers: Endgame - What Captain Marvel's Hair Means to Fans
title: Avengers: Endgame - What Captain Marvel's Hair Means to Fans
excerpt: In one of the non-life-threatening surprises in Avengers: Endgame, Captain Marvel cut her hair and pushed back against the gender binary.
description:
As long as she has been Captain Marvel, people have been talking about Carol Danvers’ hair. Avengers: Endgame is no exception.

In the lead up to the epic movie, there was a bit of a dust-up about Captain Marvel’s looks. Some fans were surprised to see that our fresh-faced hero, last seen heading off into space in the ‘90s with a very no-frills look, seemed to have picked up some makeup on her way across the galaxy toward Avengers HQ. My personal head canon? Her friend in the comics Dazzler, the mutant/intergalactic pop star taught her how to do a perfect matte lip…

[Read More]

summary:
Just saw Captain Marvel, it was awesome - she's my new favourite. 
But we're doing a double feature, we're gonna see Endgame....
body:
Just saw Captain Marvel, it was awesome - she’s my new favourite.

But we’re doing a double feature, we’re gonna see Endgame.

I’m not ready, but then I doubt I ever will be.

See you on the other side…
